Class School

  • java.lang.Object
    • School

  • public class School
extends java.lang.Object
    This class houses the student objects at two levels: school and building. The building class is found at the end, nested within the school class.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  School.Building
      Class for creating a building.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      School(java.lang.String name)
      Buildings are stored in a list for the sake of chronological retrieval.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean add(School.Building building)
      Adds a building to the school by placing it in the list of buildings.
      boolean add(Student student)
      Adds a student to the school without choosing a building.
      boolean add(Student student, int buildingIndex)
      Adds a student to a building within the school, by building index.
      boolean add(Student student, School.Building building)
      Adds a student to a specific building within the school, by building name.
      boolean contains(Student student)
      Checks if the school has a certain student in it.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Gets the name of the school.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args) 

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • School

        public School(java.lang.String name)
        Buildings are stored in a list for the sake of chronological retrieval.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the school

    • Method Detail

      • contains

        public boolean contains(Student student)
        Checks if the school has a certain student in it. This works by iterating through all of the associated buildings to find a match. This method is O(n) by itself, but O(n^2) including the method it calls. It is not implemented at this point because we do not have a need for it yet. It can be implemented in the future if needed.
        Parameters:
        student - the student to be searched for
        Returns:
        true if the student exists in the school

      • add

        public boolean add(School.Building building)
        Adds a building to the school by placing it in the list of buildings.
        Parameters:
        building - the building to be added
        Returns:
        true if the building is added successfully

      • add

        public boolean add(Student student,
                   School.Building building)
        Adds a student to a specific building within the school, by building name. If the building is not within the school, an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        student - the student to add to the building
        building - the building within the school
        Returns:
        true if the student is added successfully

      • add

        public boolean add(Student student,
                   int buildingIndex)
        Adds a student to a building within the school, by building index.
        Parameters:
        student - the student to add to the building
        buildingIndex - the index of the building within the school.
        Returns:
        true if the student is added successfully

      • add

        public boolean add(Student student)
        Adds a student to the school without choosing a building. The student will be added to the first building that is not full.
        Parameters:
        student - the student to be added
        Returns:
        true if the student is added successfully

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Gets the name of the school.
        Returns:
        the name of the school

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
